meanings.definition: To cut or chop into very small pieces
meanings.sent1: She used a sharp knife to mince the garlic for the pasta sauce.
meanings.sent2: The chef will mince the vegetables finely for the salad.
meanings.sent3: He tried to mince the meat with a spoon, but it didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: The artist's delicate brushstrokes mince the colors together beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The machine can mince the meat in seconds, saving time in the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To walk with short, quick steps
meanings.sent1: The toddler began to mince across the room towards his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The elderly lady had to mince slowly due to her sore knees.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to mince on the hot sand, looking quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The mouse would mince around the kitchen at night, searching for crumbs.
meanings.sent5: The dancer had to mince in time with the music during the performance.

meanings.definition: To speak in an overly polite or refined way
meanings.sent1: She would mince her words when speaking to the important guests.
meanings.sent2: The politician would mince his speech to avoid offending anyone.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to mince its responses, sounding very artificial.
meanings.sent4: The actor would mince his lines on stage, trying to impress the audience.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to mince her feedback to the students, being careful not to upset them.
